body_html:
I can try tomorrow when I am back at the office.

But for now I can provide more info :
1 - I have checked if I was loading the righ .meta and .ckpt
2 - Even tried by cleaning the checkpoints folder and starting from zero. The files were definitely being created/updated.

I found some questions regarding this on stack overflow, But there was no consensus other than saver should work.
Yet I haven't found anyone stating that it works flawless with a python environment reset.

Other than that I tried starting a new graph, load the meta and restored session: If we reset the python kernel, no dice, some weight matrix is not loaded and accuracy goes down.

But if I do it without a kernel restart there is no problem.. The new graph keeps the accuracy and behaves like before.

body:
I can try tomorrow when I am back at the office. 

But for now I can provide more info : 
1 - I have checked if I was loading the righ .meta and .ckpt
2 - Even tried by cleaning the checkpoints folder and starting from zero.  The files were definitely being created/updated.

I found some questions regarding this on stack overflow, But there was no consensus other than saver should work. 
Yet I haven't found anyone stating that it works flawless with a  python environment reset.

Other than that I tried starting a new graph, load the meta and restored  session: If we reset the python kernel, no dice, some weight matrix is not loaded and accuracy goes down.

But if I do it **without** a kernel restart there is no problem.. The new graph keeps the accuracy and behaves like before.
